According to the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP), "sexuality is a normal part of human development, and children can begin to explore their sexuality as early as age 5 or 6." This statement resonates with scientific evidence that indicates that children as young as 9 years old have expressed sexual curiosity and engaged in sexual play. These behaviors are not necessarily indicative of precociousness but rather a natural curiosity about the physical and emotional aspects of intimacy.
